title: Patch (computing)
summary: A patch is a set of changes to a computer program or its supporting data designed to update, fix, or improve it.[1] This includes fixing security vulnerabilities[1] and other bugs, with such patches usually being called bugfixes or bug fixes.[2] Patches are often written to improve the  functionality, usability, or performance of a program. The majority of patches are provided by software vendors for operating system and application updates.
